author: Liqwid Labs
title: Haskell Devs for Liqwid Plutus SC's
description: Plutus is Cardano's smart contract layer written in Haskell. 1st target users to build secure DeFi contracts in Plutus are senior Haskellers

assessments.note: Sure, to build a Smart Contract in Cardano network, you need Haskell developer. And I agree to finish Liqwid project, what the proposer needs at the moment is more knowledgeable DEVS.
Part of a continued stream of effort in developing the ideas behind liquid
This step addresses the challenge and it his very important because it will enable liqwid to interact with cardano oracle's information's.
The dApps generating the most value in fees on Ethereum are all in the DeFi space, Liqwid is the first DeFi dApp to launch on Cardano
Liqwid is aiming to deliver the 1st DeFi dApp on Cardano, this is effectively addressing the challenge.
This is Cardano's 1st catalyst funded DeFi dapp. The upside to the entire ecosystem if this DeFi dApp is properly developed is massive.
The top dApps on Ethereum today are all DeFi protocols, Liqwid is the 1st of these on Cardano.

The team behind this proposal has been recognized in the Cardano community. Building a dApp with this many pieces with the current build of Plutus is a task for pro Haskell devs. Liqwid has them on board
I can definitely see this will be a very successful project for the Cardano ecosystem.
Compete proposal and a solid team behindit
The proposal to fund the development of smart contracts in a Plutus dApp effectively addresses the challenge.

I follow Liqwid Medium and Twitter. From my opinion, their project is ongoing quite good. And with this funding, they could finish the smart contract project until deployment in MainNet within 10 Scrum Sprint
There is a clear track record and communication with the community across all initiatives taken on by this team so far.

Progresses are being made. There is code being written and there are also status reports being delivered. I've also been in touch in twitter and youtube interviews and  Dewayne Cameron is a skilled entrepreneur with a noble cause

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PbZmn01ISs6zOB4uIPkKaP1JI9ox5zxhHE2Legh_5Qg/edit

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sPxvHi7QCLw&t=255s
The proposal makes clear Liqwid has a team of pro Haskell engineers behind it. MLabs experience seems to be concentrated in open source Haskell/fintech software development.
Liqwid team is working with senior Haskell engineers to build their Plutus smart contracts. The development roadmap and project plan are described in detail in this proposal.
The author includes a project roadmap, Github repos to establish previous experience and metrics to verify project developments against
The team has a complete plan to develop the 1st DeFi lending protocol on Cardano.
author includes a complete development plan that has high chances of successful launch given the team.
Very clear roadmap and detailed plan. I believe that the proposer will be able to implement it successfully.
Track record of success since winning the WyoHackathon/fund2 implementation established, as well as a project plan, metrics and budget are all  provided.
All of the info presented is sufficient and easy to follow as a CA

Yes, the project planning is quite feasible. And it should support Liqwid project until deployment in Mainnet. And it's very helpful, if at the end the proposer could  do contributions to the Plutus system itself, by sharing the DEV tooling in Python/JavaScript.
I think the proposal provides the technical detail required, plan to address the challenge accordingly and the metrics and budget breakdown seems reasonable

Team has shown a clear record of success since winning the WyoHackathon/fund2 progress. The project plan, metrics and budget are all  provided and provide additional clarity into the project's current status.
The proposing team has partnered with the MLabs senior Haskellers and have the proficiency in Plutus required to implement the proposal.
The author establishes this team has strong experience in open source Haskell and has the available resources to implement the proposal on budget/time.
We need more proposals like Liqwid that are attempting to mitigate the current problems of the DeFi ecosystem.
creation of a decentralized money market dApp on Cardano is a must have
The developers behind this proposal are also developing Plutus smart contracts for Liqwid, establishing their ability to build on top of Plutus/Cardano infrastructure.
This is a team of senior Haskell devs and the Liqwid team of Defi analysts building the 1st DEfI DAPP

solution: Team of 6 senior fullstack Haskell devs with deep fintech backgrounds currently building on the Plutus eUTXO smart contract system on TN.
experience:
Develops fintech payment platforms & works on open-source projects in Haskell.
juspay.in/ Migrated business logic from Node.JS to Haskell.
